017
018package org.tquadrat.foundation.svg.type;
019
020import static java.lang.Math.abs;
021import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
022import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNotEmptyArgument;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.util.StringUtils.format;
024
025import java.util.function.IntUnaryOperator;
026
027import org.apiguardian.api.API;
028import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
029
030/**
031 *  The implementation for SVG values representing colors.
032 *
033 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
034 *  @version $Id: SVGColor.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $
035 *  @since 0.0.5
036 *
037 *  @UMLGraph.link
038 */
039@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: SVGColor.java 980 2022-01-06 15:29:19Z tquadrat $" )
040@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
041public final class SVGColor extends SVGPaint
042{
043        /*-----------*\
044    ====** Constants **========================================================
045        \*-----------*/
046    /**
047     *  This constant is used to force the colour values into the range from
048     *  0 to 255.
049     */
050    private static final int m_Divisor = 0x100;
051
052        /*------------------------*\
053    ====** Static Initialisations **===========================================
054        \*------------------------*/
055    /**
056     *  The type 'inherit'.
057     */
058    public static final SVGColor COLOR_INHERIT;
059
060    static
061    {
062        COLOR_INHERIT = new SVGColor();
063    }
064
065        /*--------------*\
066    ====** Constructors **=====================================================
067        \*--------------*/
068    /**
069     *  Creates a new {@code SVGColor} instance with the type
070     *  &quot;inherit&quot;.
071     */
072    private SVGColor() { super( "inherit" ); }
073
074    /**
075     *  Creates a new {@code SVGColor} instance from the given colour
076     *  values.<br>
077     *  <br>Allowed are the values from 0 to 255, other values will be
078     *  normalised accordingly.
079     *
080     *  @param  red The red component for the colour.
081     *  @param  green   The green component for the colour.
082     *  @param  blue    The blue component for the colour.
083     */
084    public SVGColor( final int red, final int green, final int blue )
085    {
086        super( format( "#%02x%02x%02x", abs( red ) % m_Divisor, abs( green ) % m_Divisor, abs( blue ) % m_Divisor ) );
087    }   //  SVGColor()
088
089    /**
090     *  Creates a new {@code SVGColor} instance from the given colour
091     *  values.<br>
092     *  <br>Allowed are the values from 0 to 255, or 0% to 100% respectively,
093     *  other values will be normalised accordingly.
094     *
095     *  @param  flag    {@code true} if the given values are percentages,
096     *      {@code false} if they are absolute values.
097     *  @param  red The red component for the colour.
098     *  @param  green   The green component for the colour.
099     *  @param  blue    The blue component for the colour.
100     */
101    public SVGColor( final boolean flag, final int red, final int green, final int blue )
102    {
103        super( composeColorValue( flag, red, green, blue ) );
104    }   //  SVGColor()
105
106    /**
107     *  Creates a new {@code SVGColor} instance, using the given argument as a
108     *  CSS colour name.<br>
109     *  <br>The given argument may not be {@code null} nor the empty String,
110     *  but it will not undergo any further validation.
111     *
112     *  @param  color   The CSS colour name.
113     */
114    public SVGColor( final String color ) { super( requireNotEmptyArgument( color, "color" ) ); }
115
116        /*---------*\
117    ====** Methods **==========================================================
118        \*---------*/
119    /**
120     *  Composes the colour type String from the given colour values.<br>
121     *  <br>Allowed are the values from 0 to 255, or 0% to 100% respectively,
122     *  other values will be normalised accordingly.
123     *
124     *  @param  flag    {@code true} if the given values are percentages,
125     *      {@code false} if they are absolute values.
126     *  @param  red The red component for the colour.
127     *  @param  green   The green component for the colour.
128     *  @param  blue    The blue component for the colour.
129     *  @return The colour type String.
130     */
131    private static final String composeColorValue( final boolean flag, final int red, final int green, final int blue )
132    {
133        final var n = (IntUnaryOperator) v -> abs( v ) > 100 ? abs( v ) % 101 : abs( v );
134        final var retValue = flag
135            ? format( "rgb(%d%%,%d%%,%d%%)", n.applyAsInt( red ), n.applyAsInt( green ), n.applyAsInt( blue ) )
136            : format( "rgb(%d,%d,%d)", abs( red ) % m_Divisor, abs( green ) % m_Divisor, abs( blue ) % m_Divisor );
137
138        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
139        return retValue;
140    }   //  composeColorValue()
141
142    /**
143     *  {@inheritDoc}
144     */
145    @Override
146    public final boolean equals( final Object obj )
147    {
148        var retValue = this == obj;
149        if( !retValue && (obj instanceof SVGColor other) )
150        {
151            retValue = value().equals( other.value() );
152        }
153
154        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
155        return retValue;
156    }   //  equals()
157}
158//  class SVGColor
159
160/*
161 *  End of File
162 */
